page.title: 09Our Local School
page.content: The school building in the village of Kirkfieldbank dates from 1876, although there was a school here long before that date. All the local children used to start and finish their education in the present school. It was then called a Junior Secondary School. Pupils used to leave school at the age of 14 years. For the past twenty years or so pupils have stayed for only seven years, leaving at between 11\ years and 12\ years and going on up to Lanark Grammar School. Lessons too, have changed. There is less rote learning and silent working. Now children study in a friendly, stimulating atmosphere, and are often out studying the surrounding environment. Some children walk to the school, others come by bus.
